intro: Stylidium graminifolium, commonly known as the grassleaf sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orphiraceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, sun-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. It is an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
